Schedule Advising Appointments through OneDePaul. Bio and Research Information Eric Schwabe received his B.S. from Carnegie Mellon University in 1986 and his Ph.D. from the Massachusetts Institute of Technology in 1991. Before coming to DePaul, he held research and teaching positions at Carnegie Mellon University and Northwestern University. His general area of research interest is theoretical computer science, with particular interests in the theory of parallel algorithms and architectures and in the design of high-performance fault-tolerant disk arrays.
